item.title: POLL: Most Republicans Still Believe That Iraq Had WMD
item.description: POLL: Most Republicans Still Believe That Iraq Had WMD http://t.co/PUzpickc
item.content:encoded: POLL: Most Republicans Still Believe That Iraq Had WMD http://t.co/PUzpickc POLL: Most Republicans Still Believe That Iraq Had WMD | A new poll conducted by Dartmouth government professor Benjamin Valentino found that 63 percent of Republican respondents still believe that Iraq had weapons of mass destruction when the United States invaded in 2003, even though this assertion has been thoroughly debunked. In comparison, only 27 percent of independents and less than 15 percent of Democrats believed in the misinformation. Additionally, 64 percent of Republican respondents believe that President Obama was born in another country. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: thinkprogress.org

item.content:encoded: Adopted son says Jerry Sandusky molested him http://t.co/QD3skMfh Matt Sandusky, one of Jerry Sandusky's adopted children, has said that he was molested by the former Penn State defensive coordinator, according to a statement from his lawyers. The allegation comes as Sandusky is awaiting the verdict in his child rape trial. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: cnn.com

item.title: SHOCK: Sharpton Blames Holder Contempt Charge On Racism
item.description: SHOCK: @TheRevAl Sharpton Blames Holder Contempt Charge On Racism http://t.co/zN1TLOjn - My latest at #Breitbart
item.content:encoded: SHOCK: @TheRevAl Sharpton Blames Holder Contempt Charge On Racism http://t.co/zN1TLOjn - My latest at #Breitbart How easy it must be to live your life as Al Sharpton does. Only the race-baiting NBC News star can look at the tragic events of the Fast and Furious scandal that ended with the death of a Latino border patrol agent and see Attorney General Eric Holder as the real victim. In the Huffington Post yesterday, Mr. Sharpton likened the House Oversight Committee's contempt vote on the chief law enforcement official to the NYPD practice of "Stop and Frisk" which critics call a racially motivated police state tactic. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: breitbart.com

item.title: 'The Cycle': Inside MSNBC's New 3 PM Show

item.content:encoded: 'The Cycle': Inside MSNBC's New 3 PM Show http://t.co/UQXWp8DS MSNBC has found its replacement for Dylan Ratigan's show: "The Cycle." The new program, which the network was set to announce on Thursday, will feature a permanent cast of four: conservative commentator S.E. Cupp, author and pundit Touré, Salon writer Steve Kornacki and former Congressional candidate Krystal Ball. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: huffingtonpost.com

item.title: WH's Carney Forgets Name Of Slain Border Patrol Agent | RealClearPolitics
item.description: Video - WH's Carney Forgets Name Of Slain Border Patrol Agent http://t.co/bietJteP #obama #fastandfurious #p2 #dem #tcot #tlot #ucot #sgp
item.content:encoded: Video - WH's Carney Forgets Name Of Slain Border Patrol Agent http://t.co/bietJteP #obama #fastandfurious #p2 #dem #tcot #tlot #ucot #sgp "We absolutely agree with the need to find out the truth about why Fast & Furious happened, why the tactic, again, was employed in the previous administration, in different operations and was stopped by this Attorney General, why it came about. And that's why the Attorney General referred it to Inspector General. That is why we have provided Congress every document that pertains to the operation itself that is at issue here when you talk about the family that you referred to," White House press secretary Jay Carney said at his briefing today. "The Terry family," Carney said after ABC's Jake Tapper reminded him of the name. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: realclearpolitics.com

item.title: Zimmerman's Reenactment of Trayvon Martin Shooting
item.description: George #Zimmerman speaks for the first time http://t.co/LvbfV0iF Hours of new audio and video released
item.content:encoded: George #Zimmerman speaks for the first time http://t.co/LvbfV0iF Hours of new audio and video released "He took my head and slammed it against the concrete several times, and each time I thought my head was going to explode and I thought I was going to lose consciousness," George Zimmerman told police the day after he shot and killed Trayvon Martin. "I started screaming for help," but Martin pressed his hands over Zimmerman's mouth and nose, he said. "He told me to shut the f&#k up, and I was suffocating." Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: abcnews.go.com
